messages: 587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (01:29): yes? (I usually like to know what the question is when I'm pinged)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:29): hey dude
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:30): just wondering if you knew if we were going to have a telecon yet, and whether you had an agenda for it in the works at all
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (01:30): still leaning towards it, but teetering a bit now and then.
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:30): needs to prepare for the telecon if we have one, but is in a meeting all day tomorrow and the meeting would be the morning of hte next day
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (01:31): latest info is that 104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01 gave availability info
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (01:32): ew. so you need an agenda more than 24 hours in advance.
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:32): ideally
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:32): if possible
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (01:32): and I'm due for family time in 30 minutes
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:32): if you can get one early on tomorrow that would work too
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:33): really it need about 12 hours notice, since i'll be sleeping for 8 of those hours :-)
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (01:33): if you have 10 minutes now, maybe I could bounce some ideas off you and get it done... let's see...
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:33): s/it/i/
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:33): sure

587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (01:34): agenda + introduction to W3C teleconference tools, 17f9b78129866dff3cbd228a8d985fbf, RRSAgent (20 to 30 minuntes, timed; optional for those that have been to a W3C telcon before)
17f9b78129866dff3cbd228a8d985fbf (01:34): notes agendum 1 added
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (01:34): agenda + Convene, take roll, review agenda
17f9b78129866dff3cbd228a8d985fbf (01:34): notes agendum 2 added
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (01:34): hmm... then the order gets less clear... 17f9b78129866dff3cbd228a8d985fbf will let us re-order them, so don't put too much stock in the order yet...
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (01:35): agenda + Proposed Design Principles
17f9b78129866dff3cbd228a8d985fbf (01:35): notes agendum 3 added
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (01:35): agenda + HTML5 review
17f9b78129866dff3cbd228a8d985fbf (01:35): notes agendum 4 added
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (01:35): agenda + HTML WG hosting offers: XTech/Paris/May? SFO/June?
17f9b78129866dff3cbd228a8d985fbf (01:35): notes agendum 5 added
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (01:36): agenda + regular teleconference slot? (only if I get around to preparing a survey before the call)
17f9b78129866dff3cbd228a8d985fbf (01:36): notes agendum 6 added
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (01:36): I'm not sure discussion of both HTML5 review and WF2 will fit in one telcon.
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:38): i'm not sure what most of those items mean
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (01:38): the goal of the HTML5 review would be to get a few people to take action items to review the spec, or perhaps parts of it...
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:38): wouldn't we want everyone who's interested to do it?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:38): why would that need a telecon?
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (01:38): it doesn't necessarily need a telcon, but...
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:39): let me rephrase that
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (01:39): ... (a) the discussion is easier to follow if a few people are nominated to lead it...
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:39): why would getting volunteers from a telecon be better than getting them by e-mail
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (01:39): and (b) there's an anybody/somebody/nobody risk, and action items are a good way to manage it
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (01:40): if you agree to something by email, there's little consequence to not doing it.
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:40): i'm not convinced there's any consequence to agreeing to it by phone either. but ok.
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:40): it would be nice to have this agenda sent to the list, with the various things i mentioned in my mail filled in for each one

587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (01:41): most people feel pretty uncomfortable showing up to a teleconference empty-handed after they've promised to do something. At least: that's the way I'm used to getting groups to complete work.
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (01:41): yes, the agenda has to get sent to the list. let's return to your list of questions...
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:41): wow, i wish the csswg was like that
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:41): (every telecon people always turn up having not done their action items. same with the waf and other groups i'm in.)

587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (01:42): umm... I take that sort of thing pretty seriously. If you agree to do something and then don't do it, I expect some explanation, and I don't let it go unnoticed.
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:42): fair enough.
104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01 (01:42): I'm in the same all day meeting today and tomorrow and 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e.  (CSS f2f)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:43): s/and H/as H/
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (01:44): I'm aware that some groups have a pattern of action items with no progress week after week. that's no way to run a group, IMO.
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:44): no disagreement from me there
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (01:44): if you don't get it done, I find somebody who will, or we decide together that it's not worth doing, or something.
104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01 (01:44): but if I do my CSS action items somebody will block the draft from being published, so why bother?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:44): danc: sorry if i sound too negative, i'm just too used to meetings that are wastes of time, i'll try to give yours a chance :-)
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (01:45): excellent. that's all I ask.

69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:45): 587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef: would be nice to see the information for the items i mentioned in that mail for each action item, though, i think that would go a long way towards determining if the meetings are being a success

587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (01:46): "What problem the meeting is supposed to be fixing" ... (a) we have agreed to produce an HTML spec, and we don't have one yet. further, many of us are not clear on which end of this WG is up, or where it's going.
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (01:46): [read (b) for "further" there, perhaps]

587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (01:47): "Why e-mail has failed to solve the issue, why a meeting is expected to solve the problem better". voice has all sorts of subtle clues that text doesn't give. whether somebody hesitates or not can say a lot.
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (01:47): also, a straw poll can be done in a few seconds rather than a few days
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:48): i meant those questions to be specific to the issues raised
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:48): to the agenda items, i mean
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:48): as opposed to general comparisons of audioconference vs e-mail vs irc, where each has pros and cons
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (01:48): hmm... so 5 questions per agendum? hmm...
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:49): well the answers would be different for each item, yeah
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (01:50): this order is getting taller... not unreasonable, but you're also asking for expedited service.
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (01:50): and we just used 20 of my 30 minutes. hm.
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:51): well items 1 and 2 seem to have obvious answers
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:51): it's items 3 and 4 that are the "work" items

587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (01:51): the biggest problem I see with trying to evaluate whether the meeting is a success is that there's no way to measure it. There's no way to answer "how productive would the WG have been had we not had the meeting?"
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:52): (items 5 and 6 being just about future meetings, which presumably would have the same process of going through these steps)
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (01:52): This is management, not engineering. I make up an answer, and we find out much later whether it's a good one.
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:52): well, for example, something like:
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:52): "if someone has volunteered to organise and lead an effort to review the html5 group with a deadline, then the meeting was a success"
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:53): might be a good answer for your "html5 review" item
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:53): based on what you said earlier
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (01:53): ah... but that requires that I tip my hand...
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:53): er yes
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:53): 587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef: i think it would be helpful if we were open, yes :-)
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (01:54): unfortunately, having an agenda is incompatible with having a hidden agenda, if you want to measure whether useful progress was made on teh agenda
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (01:54): when you're recruiting people to do work, sometimes it's best to let them offer before you ask in so many words.
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:55): well you don't have to ask, but we still have to be clear about what the intent is
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (01:55): I think reviewing might be premature without understanding what output is expected from the review or what decisions, if any, we would base on it
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:55): yeah
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (01:55): so I would not volunteer to lead it
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (01:55): I'll keep that in mind. but I also ask that to some extent, you trust me to do what, in my experience, is effective.
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (01:55): because I wouldn't know what my deliverable would be
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (01:56): yes, review might well be premature. that's why I want to discuss it by phone in a group setting... to get a feel for what people are comfortable with.
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:56): 587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef: hey, you're not trusting what i think is effective ;-)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:57): well, you want a telecon :-)
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (01:57): that doesn't mean I don't trust you to be effective by email/irc/etc.
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (01:58): I have found all the w3c telecons I've attended to be a frustrating mess, but I'm willing to give it a shot
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:58): danc: i was just teasing
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (01:58): is a little depressed to hear that w3c is wasting so much of people's time...
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (01:59): I think that's the #1 job of a chair: to make sure people feel their time was well spent.

69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:59): 587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef: but still, i would appreciate it if you could send the information i listed tomorrow or something, at least for the agenda items that you'd like myself and others to attend (as opposed to #1, e.g., which would just be a tutorial for newbies, as it were)
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (01:59): yes, I'm going to try, 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (02:00): cool, thanks
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (02:00): is there some particular time of day that makes a difference?
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (02:00): as far as when the agenda comes out?
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (02:00): I'm aiming for T-24 hours, but you said something about "early in the day" or something
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (02:01): earlier is better, 6pm PDT is when i go offline and won't be back online before the meeting probably
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (02:01): oh. T-24hrs comes before 6pm PDT
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (02:02): yeah, that's about T-12 or so
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (02:02): it's family time.
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (02:02): is away: family time
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (02:02): later
